    #Algebraic Geometry
    2017

    (a) Define what it means for a variety XXX to be non-singular at a point P∈XP \in XP∈X.

    (b) Let X⊆PnX \subseteq \mathbb{P}^{n}X⊆Pn be a hypersurface Z(f)Z(f)Z(f) for f∈k[x0,…,xn]f \in k\left[x_{0}, \ldots, x_{n}\right]f∈k[x0​,…,xn​] an irreducible homogeneous polynomial. Show that the set of singular points of XXX is Z(I)Z(I)Z(I), where I⊆I \subseteqI⊆ k[x0,…,xn]k\left[x_{0}, \ldots, x_{n}\right]k[x0​,…,xn​] is the ideal generated by ∂f/∂x0,…,∂f/∂xn.\partial f / \partial x_{0}, \ldots, \partial f / \partial x_{n} .∂f/∂x0​,…,∂f/∂xn​.

    (c) Consider the projective plane curve corresponding to the affine curve in A2\mathbb{A}^{2}A2 given by the equation

    x4+x2y2+y2+1=0.x^{4}+x^{2} y^{2}+y^{2}+1=0 . x4+x2y2+y2+1=0.

    where ∣n⟩|n\rangle∣n⟩ is the normalised state of the electron localised on the nth n^{\text {th }}nth  lattice site. Using periodic boundary conditions ∣N+1⟩≡∣1⟩|N+1\rangle \equiv|1\rangle∣N+1⟩≡∣1⟩, solve for the spectrum of this Hamiltonian to derive the dispersion relation

    E(k)=E0−2Jcos⁡(ka)E(k)=E_{0}-2 J \cos (k a) E(k)=E0​−2Jcos(ka)
